title: Legal notices
purpose: Legal notices provide access to copyright statements, trademarks, patents, and more.

title: Blogs about BlueXP platform automation
purpose: There are several blog articles available to help you better understand the technologies and approaches available for BlueXP automation. Use the resources on this page to get help integrating BlueXP and Cloud Volumes ONTAP with your infrastructure.

title: Overview of BlueXP automation options
purpose: DevOps teams use a variety of tools to automate the setup and administration of their data center runtime environments. NetApp supports many of these technologies for BlueXP and Cloud Volumes ONTAP automation. The tools are commonly based on an Infrastructure as Code (IaC) design.
key_tasks: Terraform
Ansible

title: API reference
purpose: This API reference contains the details of the ONTAP management service REST API calls, including resources, endpoints, parameters, and status codes. You can refer to this content when developing applications that use the API.

title: Definitions
purpose: This section describes existing data format definitions. The data definitions are used when making REST API calls.
key_tasks: Definitions

title: Resources
purpose: There are many API calls available for each resource. Validates an Azure account request. Creates a NSS account.
key_tasks: Resources

title: Typical Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment
purpose: A summary of the major steps needed to deploy and administer a Cloud Volumes ONTAP instance using the associated REST API is presented below.

title: Overview
purpose: ONTAP management service is composed of multiple related REST APIs that enable you to administer your cloud-based and on-premises ONTAP storage resources. Using the REST APIs, you can perform many different operations, including managing Cloud Volumes ONTap single-node and
key_tasks: Cloud Volumes ONTAP operations
On-premises ONTAP operations
API workflows
API reference

title: Prepare to use the API
purpose: There are several things you should do to prepare to use the BlueXP REST API and associated workflows. You'll need a NetApp account to acquire an access token required to issue the REST API calls.

title: Security
purpose: NetApp BlueXP services use OAuth 2.0 for authorization. All connections are protected using the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol.

title: Add a capacity to an Elastic Volume aggregate
purpose: You can use this workflow to add capacity to an existing aggregate with Elastic Volumes enabled. Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment.
key_tasks: Add capacity for single node
Add capacity for high availability pair

title: Create a working environment with BYOL licensing (node-based)
purpose: You can use this workflow to create a new Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment using bring-your-own-license (BYOL) licensing. A marketplace subscription is not required.
key_tasks: Create working environment for single node
Create working environment for high availability pair

title: Create a working environment with a capacity-based license
purpose: You can create a new Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment using capacity-based licensing. A marketplace subscription is required. You can add more volumes after creating the working environment.
key_tasks: Create working environment for single node
Create working environment for high availability pair

title: Create a working environment with PAYGO (node-based)
purpose: You can create a new Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment using a pay-as-you-go (PAYGO) subscription. You can add more volumes after creating the working environment.
key_tasks: Create working environment for single node
Create working environment for high availability pair

title: Delete a working environment
purpose: You can delete an existing Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment. Select the working environment to use based on the type of deployment. Delete a working environment for a single node system.
key_tasks: Delete a working environment for single node
Delete working environment for high availability pair

title: Get working environments
purpose: You can retrieve the public identifier, working environment identifier, and the storage virtual machine name for Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environments. You can use this workflow to retrieve the working environment details for a single node system.
key_tasks: Get working environments for single node
Get working environment for high availability pair

title: Create an AWS cloud provider account
purpose: You can use this workflow to create an AWS cloud provider account. You must have AWS credentials before you begin.
key_tasks: Step 1. Get the SaaS marketplace account
Step 2. Create the account

title: Get EBS volume types
purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the supported EBS volume types. You can choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment: Single Node or High Availability.
key_tasks: Get EBS volume types for single node
Get EBS volume types for high availability pair

title: Get key pairs
purpose: You can use the key pairs endpoint to retrieve the AWS key pairs for specific regions. Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment.
key_tasks: Get key pairs for single node
Get key pairs for high availability pair

title: Get packages
purpose: You can use the packages endpoint to retrieve the Cloud Volumes ONTAP packages configuration information.Choose the workflow to use based on the type of cloud deployment.
key_tasks: Get packages for single node
Get packages for high availability pair

title: Get permutations
purpose: You can use the permutations endpoint to retrieve the Cloud Volumes ONTAP configuration information. The REST API call uses the following method and endpoint.
key_tasks: Get permutations for single node
Get permutations for high availability pair

title: Get regions
purpose: This workflow retrieves the AWS regions in which an Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment may be created. You can use this workflow to retrieve the regions for a single node system.
key_tasks: Get regions for single node
Get regions for high availability pair

title: Get route tables
purpose: You can use the route tables endpoint to retrieve the route names labels for each VPC and their subnet association information. We use the Get route tables workflow only for the high availability pair.
key_tasks: Step 1. Get the region
Step 2. Get the VPC
Step 3. Get the route tables

title: Get list of virtual private clouds
purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve a list of the available virtual private clouds (VPCs) Select the region to use and the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment.
key_tasks: Get VPCs for single node
Get VPCs for high availability pair

title: Add disks to aggregate
purpose: You can use this workflow to add disks to an aggregate for a single node working environment. Select the working environment to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment.
key_tasks: Add disks to an aggregate for single node
Add disks to an aggregate for high availability pair

title: Create an aggregate
purpose: You can use this workflow to create an aggregate for a single node working environment. Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment.
key_tasks: Create aggregate for single node
Create aggregate for high availability pair

title: Create a CIFS server configuration
purpose: If you want to create CIFS volumes on your Cloud Volumes ONTAP system, you first need to configure the CifS server. Review the link:https://.netapp.com/us-en/ontap/smb-config/set-up
key_tasks: Create CIFS server configuration for single node
Create CIFS server configuration for high availability pair

title: Create quote
purpose: You can create a quote for a new volume which returns a resource quote needed to satisfy the request. The resource quote contains aggregate information where the volume will be created and confirms if the space is available.
key_tasks: Create quote for single node
Create quote for high availability pair

title: Create volume using CIFS
purpose: If the properties `aggregateName` and `maxNumOfDisksApprovedToAdd` are not provided on the REST API call, the response will fail with a suggested name for the aggregate and the number of disks needed to fulfill the request.Choose the workflow to use
key_tasks: Create volume using CIFS for single node
Create volume using CIFS for high availability pair

purpose: There are two workflows available depending on whether a new or existing iGroup is used. Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment.
key_tasks: Create volume using iSCSI for single node
Create volume using iSCSI for high availability pair

title: Create a volume using NFS
purpose: If the properties `aggregateName` and `maxNumOfDisksApprovedToAdd` are not provided on the REST API call, the response will fail with a suggested name for the aggregate and the number of disks needed to fulfill the request.
key_tasks: Create a volume using NFS for single node
Create a volume using NFS for high availability pair

title: Delete an aggregate
purpose: You can delete an existing disk aggregate. Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. Select the working environment to use.
key_tasks: Delete aggregate for single node
Delete aggregate for high availability pair

title: Delete a CIFS server configuration
purpose: You can use this workflow to delete a CIFS server configuration for an existing Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment.
key_tasks: Delete CIFS server configuration for single node
Delete CIFS server configuration for high availability pair

title: Delete volume
purpose: You can use this workflow to delete a volume for a single node working environment. Select the working environment and choose the workflow to use.
key_tasks: Delete volume for single node
Delete volume for high availability pair

title: Get aggregates
purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment: cloud, rest,api, get aggregates. 'You can retrieve a list of available disk aggregates'

Get aggregates for high availability pair

title: Get CIFS server configurations
purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the CIFS server configurations for an existing Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment.
key_tasks: Get CIFS server configuration for single node
Get CIFS server configuration for high availability pair

title: Get iGroups
purpose: iGroups is a collection of initiators (iSCSI clients) The iGroups information is required when creating a volume with the iSCSI protocol using an existing iGroup. You can use this workflow to retrieve all the initiator groups.
key_tasks: Get iGroups for single node
Get iGroups for high availability pair

title: Get volumes
purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. Select the working environment and choose the `publicId` value. You can issue the REST API c c.
key_tasks: Get volumes for single node
Get volumes for high availability pair

title: Modify a volume
purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. Modify a volume for a single node.
key_tasks: Modify a volume for single node
Modify volume for high availability pair

purpose: You can create a new aggregate within an Azure working environment using this workflow. You can choose the storage type and the working environment.

Step 2. Select the Azure Storage Account Types
Step 3. Create the aggregate

purpose: You can delete an existing Azure Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment. Choose the workflow to use based on the type of deployment: Single Node or High availability.

purpose: You can retrieve the public identifier, working environment ID, the storage virtual machine name for Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environments. You can use this workflow to retrieve the working environments' detail.

purpose: An Azure cloud provider account holds Azure access keys required to perform actions in Azure. An API call uses the following method and endpoint.

purpose: This REST API call uses the following method and endpoint. Make sure that you've the Azure subscription ID. You can obtain the ID from the Azure portal.

title: Before you begin
purpose: There are several common workflows you can use with any of the public cloud providers or ONTAP on-premises clusters. The workflows are organized into the following functional categories: identity and access, BlueXP SaaS, and rest.
key_tasks: Workflow categories
Connector setup

title: Create an NSS key
purpose: You can create the key for a specific NetApp Support Site account. You can issue a REST API call to create an NSS key.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the account
Step 2. Create the NSS key

title: Delete an NSS key
purpose: You can delete an NetApp Support Site (NSS) key. Select the account to use and the NSS key to delete. You can issue a REST API call to delete the keys.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the account to use
Step 2. Select the NSS key to delete
Step 3. Delete the NSS keys

title: Get accounts
purpose: You can perform this workflow to retrieve accounts. You must generate a bearer token to authenticate and access the BlueXP REST API.

title: Get an NSS key
purpose: You can retrieve the key for a specific NetApp Support Site account. You can issue the REST API call to retrieve the NSS key.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the account
Step 2. Select the NSS key to retrieve
Step 3. Retrieve the NSS key

title: Get NSS keys
purpose: You can retrieve all of the available NetApp Support Site credential keys. Select the accountId to use the workflow link:wf_common_identity_get_provider_accounts.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the account to use
Step 2. Retrieve the NSS keys

title: Get cloud provider accounts
purpose: You can retrieve a list of the cloud provider accounts that have been added to BlueXP. This REST API call uses the following method and endpoint.

title: Get SaaS marketplace account
purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the current marketplace account and subscriptions. The subscription identifies how the various cloud services used by the account are charged.

title: Get supported services
purpose: This workflow describes how to use the REST API to retrieve the two ID values. You can also use the BlueXP web UI to get these values.

title: Get tenants
purpose: You can retrieve a list of tenants visible to the user currently signed in through the account workspace. You can also get the account identifier through the BlueXP web UI.
key_tasks: Step 1. Get the account identifier
Step 2. Get the account workspace

title: Attach SaaS subscription
purpose: You can use this workflow to attach a BlueXP SaaS subscription to a cloud provider account. Select the cloud provider from the list of allowed values below.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the cloud provider path parameter
Step 2. Determine the account identifier path parameter
Step 3. Get the SaaS marketplace account
Step 4. Attach the subscription

title: Get active task
purpose: All of the requests made to the BlueXP REST API are processed asynchronously except those using the HTTP GET method. Each of these asynchronous requests is assigned a unique identifier which is returned to the caller in the response. You can use the request ID to retrieve information about the background task
key_tasks: Step 1. Get the request identifier
Step 2. Get the task

title: Get the SnapMirror policies
purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the SnapMirror policies based on the source and destination Cloud Volume ONTAP instances.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment to use
Step 2. Get the SnapMirror policies

title: Get the SnapMirror SVM policies
purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the SnapMirror policies (owned by cluster admin SVM) based on the source and destination Cloud Volume ONTAP instances.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment to use
Step 2. Get the SnapMirror policies

title: Create a SnapMirror replication relationship
purpose: You can use this workflow to create a new SnapMirror replication relationship to an ONTAP working environment. You can replicate data between working environments by choosing a one-time data replication for data transfer, or a recurring schedule for disaster recovery.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Select the LIFs
Step 3. Select the SnapMirror policy
Step 4. Select the SnapMirror schedule
Step 5. Select the volume names and related storage parameters
Step 6. Create a quote
Step 7. Create the relationship

title: Delete a SnapMirror replication relationship
purpose: You can use this workflow to delete an existing SnapMirror replication relationship. Select the working environment and related values. You can issue the REST API call to delete the relationship.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment and related values
Step 2. Delete the relationship

title: Get the intercluster LIFs
purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the intercluster LIFs used in a cluster peering relationship. This workflow varies slightly depending on the cloud provider you are using.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Get the intercluster LIFs

title: Get the status of the replication relationships
purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the status of all the SnapMirror replication relationships. The workflow varies slightly depending on the cloud provider.
key_tasks: Step 1. Optionally select the tenant ID
Step 2. Get the status of the relationships

title: Get status of the replication relationships for a working environment
purpose: This workflow varies slightly depending on the cloud provider you are using. You can use this workflow to retrieve the status of all the SnapMirror replication relationships.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Get the status of the relationships

title: Get the SnapMirror relationships
purpose: This REST API call uses the following method and endpoint. An array of relationship pairs is returned as shown in the JSON output example.

title: Get the replication schedules
purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the replication schedules used for a specific working environment. This workflow varies slightly depending on the cloud provider you are using.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Get the schedules

title: Update a SnapMirror replication relationship
purpose: You can use this workflow to update an existing SnapMirror replication relationship. Select the working environment and related values for the path parameters.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment and related values
Step 2. Update the relationship

title: Before you begin
purpose: You can use the Cloud Volumes ONTAP REST APIs to programmatically administer your cloud-based resources. The workflows are organized into the following functional categories: Working environments, Aggregates, Metadata and Volumes.

Connector setup

purpose: You can use this workflow to create a new Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment using bring your own license (BYOL) licensing. A marketplace subscription is not required.

purpose: You can create a new Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment using capacity-based licensing. A marketplace subscription is required. You can add more volumes after creating the working environment.

purpose: The S3 buckets are the Google Cloud storage buckets (data containers in Google Cloud) required for data tiering and backups.Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment.

title: Get Google Cloud disk types

title: Get instance types not supporting acceleration and capacity tiering
purpose: This workflow retrieves the Google Cloud instance types which do not support the acceleration and capacity tiering. This means that these kind instance types do not use any sort of hardware accelerator. You can check the instance types while provisioning the Cloud Volumes ONTAP.
key_tasks: Get instance types for single node
Get instance types for high availability pair

purpose: This workflow retrieves the minimum number of required IPs for a Cloud Volumes ONTAP system. You can use this workflow to retrieve the Minimum Number of IPs required for a single node.

title: Get Google Cloud packages
purpose: You can use the permutations endpoint to retrieve the Cloud Volumes ONTAP configuration information. You can use this workflow to retrieve Google Cloud packages in a single node working environment.

title: Get Google Cloud permutations
purpose: You can use the permutations endpoint to retrieve the Cloud Volumes ONTAP configuration information. You can check the possible permutations that can potentially be provided for the Google Cloud workflows.

Get Google Cloud permutations for high availability pair

title: Get projects
purpose: This workflow retrieves the list of projects that the caller has permission on. You can use this workflow to retrieve projects in a single node working environment.Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment.

Get projects for high availability pair

title: Get Google Cloud regions
purpose: This workflow retrieves the Google Cloud regions in which a Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment might be created.Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volume deployment.

purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. There are two workflows available depending on whether a new or existing iGroup is used.

Create volume using iSCSI for high availability pair

title: Create a volume using NFS
purpose: You can use this workflow to create a volume accessed through NFS protocol.Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment.
key_tasks: Create a volume using NFS for single node
Create a volume using NFS for high availability pair

title: Delete aggregate
purpose: You can delete an existing disk aggregate in a Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment. You can use this workflow to delete an aggregate for a single node.
key_tasks: Delete aggregate for single node
Delete aggregate for high availability pair

title: Delete CIFS server configuration
purpose: You can use this workflow to delete a CIFS server configuration for an existing Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment.
key_tasks: Delete CIFS for single node
Delete CIFS for high availability pair

title: Delete volume
purpose: You can use this workflow to delete a volume for a  single node working environment. You can delete an existing volume.
key_tasks: Delete volume for single node
Delete volume for high availability pair

title: Get aggregates
purpose: You can retrieve a list of available disk aggregates for Cloud Volumes ONTAP in Google Cloud. Choose the workflow to use based on the type of deployment.
key_tasks: Get aggregates for single node
Get aggregates for high availability pair

title: Get CIFS server configurations
purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the CIFS server configurations for an existing Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment.
key_tasks: Get CIFS for single node
Get CIFS for high availability pair

title: Get iGroups
purpose: iGroups is a collection of initiators (iSCSI clients) The iGroups information is required when creating a volume with the iSCSI protocol using an existing iGroup.Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment.
key_tasks: Get iGroups for single node
Get iGroups for high availability pair

title: Get volumes
purpose: You can retrieve the list of volumes of Google Cloud working environment. You can use this workflow to retrieve theList of volumes for a  single node working environment for Google Cloud.
key_tasks: Get volumes for single node
Get volumes for high availability pair

title: Modify volume
purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. Modify volume for a single node working environment.
key_tasks: Modify volume for single node
Modify volume for high availability pair

title: Before you begin
purpose: There are several workflows you can use to manage the ONTAP on-premises clusters. The workflows are organized into the following functional categories: Working environments, Aggregates, Volumes and Connector setup.
key_tasks: Workflow categories
Connector setup

title: Discover working environments
purpose: You can retrieve the on-premises working environments that are visible to the user currently signed in. This REST API call uses the following method and endpoint.

title: Create a FlexGroup volume
purpose: The ONTAP cluster must be running version 9.7 or later. You should be aware of minimum and maximum size limits. See the https://www.netapp.com/pdf.html?item=12385-tr4571.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Select the aggregates and constituents
Step 3. Select the network
Step 4. Choose the size for the disk
Step 5. Create the volume

title: Get working environments
purpose: You can retrieve the on-premises working environment details such as the public identifier, name, and type of the working environment. These details can be used in the input body field while executing other on- Premises workflows.

title: Create volume using CIFS
purpose: You can use this workflow to create a volume accessed through the CIFS protocol. Choose the CifS configuration for your working environment.
key_tasks: Step 1. Choose the CIFS configuration
Step 2. Select the working environment
Step 3. Select the aggregate
Step 4. Choose the size for the disk
Step 5. Create the volume

title: Create volume using iSCSI
purpose: You can use this workflow to create a volume accessed through the iSCSI protocol. There are two workflows available depending on whether a new or existing iGroup is used.
key_tasks: Create volume using iSCSI with a new iGroup
Create volume using iSCSI with an existing iGroup

title: Create a volume using NFS
purpose: You can use this workflow to create a volume accessed through the NFS protocol. If the properties `aggregateName` and `maxNumOfDisksApprovedToAdd` are not provided on the REST API call, the response will fail.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Select the aggregate
Step 3. Select the network
Step 4. Choose the size for the disk
Step 5. Create the volume

title: Delete a volume
purpose: You can use this workflow to delete a volume. Select the working environment and choose the volume name. You can then issue a REST API call to delete the volume.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Select the volume
Step 3. Delete the volume

title: Get aggregates
purpose: You can issue a REST API call to retrieve a list of aggregates. Select the working environment to use. Use the following method and endpoint.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment to use
Step 2. Get a list of aggregates

title: Get CIFS server configurations
purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the CIFS server configurations for an existing Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment. Select the working environment by clicking the link:wf_onprem_get_wes. You can then issue a REST API call to get the C
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Get the CIFS configurations

title: Get volumes
purpose: You can retrieve the list of volumes of an on-premises working environment. You can issue a REST API call to retrieve the volumes. The API call uses the following method and endpoint.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Get the volumes

title: Modify a volume
purpose: You can modify the configuration of an existing volume. You can issue a REST API call to modify a volume.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Select the volume
Step 3. Modify the volume

title: Workflow processes
purpose: There are two broad categories of workflows associated with the ONTAP management service. They are as follows:Cloud Volumes ONT AP workflows and Workflow processes. You should be familiar with the organization and format of the Cloud Volumes on-premises workflow processes before using
key_tasks: High level organization of the workflows
Presentation of common tokens and identifiers
Working environment status requirements

title: Your first API call
purpose: You can issue a curl command to get started using a Cloud Volumes ONTAP REST API and confirm its availability. The following workflow example is very simple.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the identifier
Step 2. Get the access token

title: Basic concepts and terminology
purpose: OAuth 2.0 (OAuth2) is an authorization framework that allows client applications to obtain limited access to the protected resources at an HTTP service. The framework addresses many of the deficiencies of the traditional client/server authentication model by introducing an authorization layer as defined through four distinct roles
key_tasks: OAuth 2.0 authorization framework
OpenID Connect protocol
Auth0 platform
Auth0 user
Access tokens
Grant type
Scope
JWT encoding

title: Additional considerations
purpose: There are several additional characteristics of the BlueXP REST APIs affecting their operation and use. You should be aware of these considerations before issuing an API call.
key_tasks: Public identifiers
Asynchronous processing

title: Use the API Explorer
purpose: The API Explorer is integrated with the BlueXP API reference documentation, enabling you to test the various API endpoints while reviewing the documentation. There are several things you should consider before using the API Explorer.
key_tasks: Before you begin
Issue a REST API call

title: Basic concepts
purpose: Representational State Transfer (REST) is a style for creating distributed web applications. It establishes a set of technologies and best practices for exposing server-based resources and managing their states. The BlueXP REST APIs use mainstream protocols and standards to provide a flexible foundation.
key_tasks: Overview of the API resources
REST endpoints
Types of input parameters

title: Connector and client identifiers
purpose: Every Connector is assigned a unique identifier. This value is carried in the HTTP `x-agent-id` request header. There are several additional identifiers you typically need depending on the grant type and API call.
key_tasks: Connector
Client ID

title: Create service token
purpose: You can create a service access token that can be used by BlueXP internal services and external clients. The API call uses the *Auth0* authentication service and not a NetApp BlueXP service endpoint.

title: Create user token
purpose: You need to generate a bearer token to gain access to the BlueXP REST APIs. A user token is more commonly used for customer automation than the service token. There are two workflows available to create a user token.
key_tasks: Create a user token with federated authentication
Create a user token with nonfederated authentication

title: Get required identifiers
purpose: You can access the BlueXP web UI to retrieve the identifiers needed for the workflows. You can also obtain the ID values through the Cloud Volumes ONTAP REST API.
key_tasks: Get the Connector identifier
Get the account identifier

title: Generate an NSS user ID
purpose: You can create a NetApp Support Site user ID through the BlueXP web web UI. This ID is included when creating a BlueXP working environment.Registering support site credentials with BlueXP and creating an NSS ID enables several features, including subscription to the Cloud Volumes ONT

title: Grant types and identity verification
purpose: There are several OAuth 2.0 grant types available when requesting an access token to use with BlueXP. The grant type is based on the application requirements and authentication environment, and determines how the token is requested.
key_tasks: Refresh token
Password
Client credentials

title: HTTP details
purpose: The BlueXP REST API is based on the HTTP protocol as well as JSON for content exchange. A REST API request contains the standard HTTP methods and request headers. Not all HTTP methods are available at each of the REST endpoints.
key_tasks: Request
Response

title: Overview of the BlueXP control plane
purpose: BlueXP enables you to build, protect, and govern your hybrid multi-cloud data from a single control plane. It is composed of several distinct services, each of which exposes an associated REST API.

title: Register a service
purpose: You can register a service with BlueXP and use the associated credentials to create a service token. You must have a BlueXP account.

title: User access tokens
purpose: There are two types of access tokens that can be used to establish identity and authorization as part of performing a REST API call. The user access token is generally more common with customer automation applications. The one you select depends on your authentication environment.
key_tasks: Authentication models
Contents of a user token

title: Use the BlueXP REST APIs
purpose: A BlueXP account is required to access the platform. The system prompts you to create an account when you attempt to sign in to the BlueXP web UI. There are several things you should consider before performing a BlueXP REST API call.
key_tasks: BlueXP account
Access token usage scenarios
REST API requirements and your authentication environment
Perform an API call

title: Workflow processes and tasks
purpose: The BlueXP platform REST APIs support many different workflows and tasks. You should be familiar with their common characteristics before reviewing and using a specific API.
key_tasks: Workflows
Base URLs and REST endpoint paths
Common parameters and variables
Presentation of common tokens and identifiers
Tasks

title: Additional resources
purpose: There are additional resources you can access to get help and find more information about NetApp cloud services and support, ONTAP 9, and general REST and cloud concepts.
key_tasks: BlueXP
NetApp cloud resources
REST concepts and cloud technology

title: audit.json
purpose: The Audit service records information about the operations performed by the BlueXP services. You can use this data to determine what actions were performed, who performed them, and when they occurred. This information can be useful in forensic situations or environments where compliance is required.

purpose: "File explorer" is a command-line tool that allows users to access a file's contents. It can be used to retrieve a file, or to start a new one.

title: cbs.json
purpose: BlueXP backup and recovery is a BlueXP service that provides backup and restore capabilities. By using this service, you can automatically generate and store backups in an object store in the public or private cloud account of your choice.
